column5: FishTwentyFourSeven Where can I purchase cigars on my way from International Falls to Kenora?
Most any sport shop or gift shop has them. Nestor Falls...Sioux Narrows....Kenora Brad
Most any sport shop or gift shop has them. Nestor Falls...Sioux Narrows....Kenora Brad

Any cigar shop recomendations in Fort Frances would be greatly appreciated. A few in our crew smokes them and I believe the place we used to get them is now out of the cigar business. 12 days to Lac Seul.

Any cigar shop recomendations in Fort Frances would be greatly appreciated. A few in our crew smokes them and I believe the place we used to get them is now out of the cigar business. 12 days to Lac Seul.
I'd purchase them at the duty free store in International Falls (right next to Border Bob's). That way you don't have to pay the tax and don't suffer the poor $ exchange rate.
What kind of cigars do they have at the duty free shop? El Cheapo or some good ones at a good price. Thanks!

They sell both kinds. You can call them up at (218) 283 - 2556. Go to this URL http://www.dutyfreeamericas.com/ and work your way through 'locations' and then go to International Falls. I usually order my cigars through Fincks out of Texas. If you got time, the order usually comes within 3 - 4 business days. They are atwww.fincks.com There's nothing finer than sitting around the campfire at night drinking a bottle of Labatt's, puffing on a Padron 3000, eating freshly popped buttered popcorn, and watching the Northern Lights.
OOPS!!! Administrative error on my part. The Fincks website is http://www.finckcigarcompany.com/

Just got back from Kenora. There's a little gas station on the corner of 11 and 71 as you turn north to go to Kenora. We had to stop a and get a couple of gallons of gas to get us to IF. They had all kinds of cigars there. Maybe even some Cuban. Joe
